title: hehe
content: It looks remarkably like the official art for the game, only updated and moved to 3d.  In particular, the neck of Keen's shirt, the relative size/thickness of his arms/legs/shoes, and so on.  The only thing I'd really change is the texture you're using for his eyes... maybe something a tad darker?  Either way, it's phenomenal--congrats!

content:
In-game, Keen's helmet has always had the Packers' "G" on the side... but in the title screen art of Keen4, 5, and 6, Keen's helmet had little green blotches instead--probably to avoid licensing issues or something.

It's remarkable the amount of detail you've put on this--like I said before, the proportions and relative size of everything looks very much like the in-game art... all we need now is a brief movie download showing a clip of what you've done! ;-)

title: Re: yep
content:
The reason they didn't put the Green Bay logo on the helmet on the title screen was because it would of been copyright infringement. While that might be ok for Dave's little escapade, it couldn't be put in a commercial game. Notice the blast marks on the helmet are over where the "G" would be.

[img]http://img104.imageshack.us/img104/3017/keen4title2ow.gif[/img]

And in keen 1-3 there is a definite "G" on the side of Keen's helmet, just not the greenbay logo. In keens 4-6 it looks like there is a G but you can't tell as easily.

On the 3D realms website, in "A Look Back at Commander Keen", on the third page, they quote Tom Hall as saying this: " And he wears what I wore and had as a kid: red Converse hi-tops, jeans, Packers helmet...except his shirt was purple, 'cause that was the color left over in EGA." -[url=http://www.3drealms.com/keenhistory/keenhistory3.html]link[/url] So if you went by original intention it would probably have the actual Greenbay logo on both sides.

Pretty much it's up to interpretation of weather or not you should put the "G" on there or not. It's kind of like which side the battery goes on the Bean with Bacon. Personally I like putting the Greenbay logo on there because it looks cool and because I am already committing copyright infringement by drawing him in the first place so it really doesn't matter anymore...-----------------------
"The Adventures of Commander Keen" issue #1: [img]http://img93.imageshack.us/img93/8904/wid1kx.png[/img]

title: Re: SUPRISE
content:
I think being a cartoon, your model's head somehow differs from a real human's head.
(Except for when looking cross-eyed, or in some other exceptions) both eyes always look in the same direction.
With direction I don't mean the angle of the eye with the sagittal plane, but rather the distance between the pupil and the corner where the tear duct is (or the opposite corner).

In the last picture Keen's right pupil is right in the middle of the white of the eye, whereas his left pupil is all the way in the corner.
Compare with [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/info/shots/screen-k601.gif[/img].
Because one pupil is all the way in the corner, the other is too.

I personally think it looks too strange not to work on it, which means you have 2 options I can think of:
1) Make your model's face more human-like, or at least change the shape a bit (I think you would have to make the area between his eyes a bit flatter and/or smaller).
2) Do what cartoons do (I guess; they're usually 2D, so it doesn't really apply), and animate both eyes seperately so the thing I described in my first 2 paragraph applies.

Then there's the 3rd option which is leaving things as they are, but I figured I'd offer my opinion/tip. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: well
content: Another thing you can do to ease the cross-eyed-ness is to change the depth of Billy's focus.  Chances are you've got some sort of pointer you can move around, which the eyes are trained on--right?  (That's how I did my eyes in 3d) ... just move the pointer further away from Billy.  As it is now, I'd guess the pointer was hovering almost exactly in front of his right eye, causing his left one to jut way off into the corner to peek at it.  :-)

content:

title: Re: well
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Another thing you can do to ease the cross-eyed-ness is to change the depth of Billy's focus. Chances are you've got some sort of pointer you can move around, which the eyes are trained on--right? (That's how I did my eyes in 3d)[hr][/quote]

yes the problem is easely solved since i had taken care of the problem before i rendered (but i missjudged the look of the eyes anyway [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )
i have a point that controls two other points (one for each eye). with this i can move the eyes futher apart from eachother if needed but they are still looking in the "same direction".

i guess this catoonish character is more sensitive for these kinds of problem because you expect it to behave in a way that is not really psysically correct. the whole 3dthingy is based on a character that is built up psysically correct (with volume instead of 2d lines). much has to do with the perspective and how the perspective can make a thing look strange from different angles, field of view (FOV) ect (like with eyes and looking)

anyway, this is something to have in mind when animating. i didn't really pay attention enough to the eyes [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]


soo, let's start with Yorp-modeling!
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

title: Eye can't stand it!
content:
Gah, the eye is still wrong! Screw the maths--a bit of artistic licence never goes astray.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-furious.gif[/img]

Maybe make the right eye smaller, so there's less, or no, white on the outer edge of the iris... that way they might seem more consistent.

Other than that, awesome, as always.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

content: I like the character and the eyes too. The previous version was a bit (but only a bit) strange but there is nothing bad with them now in my opinion. What others may see as a problem is the face around the eyes as it is not like a real face, but for a cartoon character it's not a problem.

title: hmm
content:
Well, if you look at it from the perspective that it should be a stand-alone image, ready for display, then I agree with Spleen: It still looks a bit awkward.

But if you look at it from the perspective that it's going to be part of an animation, and this frame could very well be some form of in-between, where Keen is in the process of turning his head while raising/lowering his gun, this picture could easily be a single frame among dozens, and wouldn't turn up as particularly odd.

I do like this new version better--Keen's eyes are focussed on something a set distance from him, in my view. Maybe we could get a little demo movie? :-D

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani
